title: What do average Hungarians look like? - Quora

response.answer_text: The ‘average’ look of a Hungarian might be hard to pin down, since Hungary is a very diverse nation ethnically. Located in Central Europe, over the last millennium Hungary has seen its fair share of migration and blending of different nations and ethnicities. As a result pretty much any European phenotype can be found in Hungary, so the ‘average’ Hungarian might look as blonde and blue eyed as a Swede, or might look dark enough to pass as a Turk. I googled some pictures of people of note from Hungary (actors, athletes, some ordinary folks), so get ready for a lot of visual data: András Csonka (actor)  Zoltán Bereczki (actor)  Zoltán Hujber (actor)  Erika Marozsán (actor)  Péter Rudolf (actor)  Eszter Földes (actor)  Dorka Gryllus (actor)  Győző Szabó (actor)  Dénes Száraz (actor)  Károly Eperjes (actor)  Laura Cserpes (singer)  Enikő Mihalik (model)  Barbara Palvin (model)  Katinka Hosszú (swimmer)  Boglárka Kapás (swimmer)  Ádám Lang (footballer)  Ádám Pintér (footballer)  Balázs Dzsudzsák (footballer)  Attila Fiola (footballer)  Ádám Szalai (footballer)  Some people in folk costumes  Finally, a video of children singing:  Hopefully this will help you get an accurate enough idea. All in all, I’d say we look like most Europeans and nothing out of the ordinary.

Light/europid skin color is the most common, but natural blonde hair color is somewhat rare. There are traces of small traditional ethnic groups who have specific traits (such as Jász and Matyó people) but it's only evident if you know what to look for ("he looks like a Jász"), and it mostly just falls into "generic white people" for an outsider (I say "traces" because only a few people have Jász or Matyó identities). There are also present ethnic groups with different traits, such as gypsies (with most people also having it as an identity). They might be the source of your initial image, because they fit the description.
